segment.source: How to use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Customization Wizard to add URLs to auto-configure IE.
segment.target: How to use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Customization Wizard to add URLs to auto-configure IE.

segment.source: Use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Wizard (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Wizard (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Wizard
segment.target: Use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Wizard

segment.source: The Automatic Configuration page of the Internet Explorer Administration Kit (IEAK 11) Customization Wizard lets you provide URLs to the files that’ll automatically configure Internet Explorer 11 for a group of employees or devices.
segment.target: The Automatic Configuration page of the Internet Explorer Administration Kit (IEAK 11) Customization Wizard lets you provide URLs to the files that’ll automatically configure Internet Explorer 11 for a group of employees or devices.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This page only appears if you’re using the Internal version of the wizard.
segment.target: This page only appears if you’re using the Internal version of the wizard.

segment.source: You can set your proxy settings using Internet setting (.ins) files.
segment.target: You can set your proxy settings using Internet setting (.ins) files.

segment.source: You can also configure and maintain your advanced proxy settings using JScript (.js), JavaScript (.jvs), or proxy auto-configuration (.pac) script files.
segment.target: You can also configure and maintain your advanced proxy settings using JScript (.js), JavaScript (.jvs), or proxy auto-configuration (.pac) script files.

segment.source: When you provide an auto-proxy script, IE dynamically determines whether to connect directly to a host or to use a proxy server.
segment.target: When you provide an auto-proxy script, IE dynamically determines whether to connect directly to a host or to use a proxy server.

segment.source: You can use the Domain Name System (DNS) and the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) naming systems to detect and change a browser’s settings automatically when the employee first starts IE on the network.
segment.target: You can use the Domain Name System (DNS) and the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) naming systems to detect and change a browser’s settings automatically when the employee first starts IE on the network.

segment.source: For more info, see Set up auto detection for DHCP or DNS servers using IEAK 11, or refer to the product documentation for your DNS and DHCP software packages.
segment.target: For more info, see Set up auto detection for DHCP or DNS servers using IEAK 11, or refer to the product documentation for your DNS and DHCP software packages.

segment.source: To check the existing settings on your employee’s devices
segment.target: To check the existing settings on your employee’s devices

segment.source: Open IE, click Tools, click Internet Options, and then click the Connections tab.
segment.target: Open IE, click Tools, click Internet Options, and then click the Connections tab.

segment.source: Click LAN Settings and make sure that the Use automatic configuration script box is selected, confirming the path and name of the file in the Address box.
segment.target: Click LAN Settings and make sure that the Use automatic configuration script box is selected, confirming the path and name of the file in the Address box.

segment.source: To use the Automatic Configuration page
segment.target: To use the Automatic Configuration page

segment.source: Check the Automatically detect configuration settings box to automatically detect browser settings.
segment.target: Check the Automatically detect configuration settings box to automatically detect browser settings.

segment.source: Check the Enable Automatic Configuration box if you plan to automatically change your IE settings after deployment, using configuration files.
segment.target: Check the Enable Automatic Configuration box if you plan to automatically change your IE settings after deployment, using configuration files.

segment.source: You can then:
segment.target: You can then:

segment.source: Type the length of time (in minutes) for how often settings are to be applied in your company.
segment.target: Type the length of time (in minutes) for how often settings are to be applied in your company.

segment.source: Putting zero (0), or nothing, in this box will cause automatic configuration to only happen when the computer’s restarted.
segment.target: Putting zero (0), or nothing, in this box will cause automatic configuration to only happen when the computer’s restarted.

segment.source: Type the location to your .ins file.
segment.target: Type the location to your .ins file.

segment.source: You can edit this file directly to make any necessary changes.
segment.target: You can edit this file directly to make any necessary changes.

segment.source: The updates will take effect the next time your employee starts IE, or during your next scheduled update.
segment.target: The updates will take effect the next time your employee starts IE, or during your next scheduled update.

segment.source: Type the location to your automatic proxy script file.
segment.target: Type the location to your automatic proxy script file.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you specify URLs for both auto-config and auto-proxy, the auto-proxy URL will be incorporated into the .ins file.
segment.target: If you specify URLs for both auto-config and auto-proxy, the auto-proxy URL will be incorporated into the .ins file.

segment.source: The correct form for the URL is .
segment.target: The correct form for the URL is .

segment.source: Click Next to go to the Proxy Settings page or Back to go to the Connection Settings page.
segment.target: Click Next to go to the Proxy Settings page or Back to go to the Connection Settings page.
